name: University of Strathclyde
whySelected: Frequently asked Scotland option with a practical reputation and international admissions track record.
visaRiskNotes: More selective than budget universities, so weak academics may not convert.

name: University of Sunderland
whySelected: Budget city option with steady international admissions history.
visaRiskNotes: Not suitable for weak profiles with gaps or borderline finances due to credibility scrutiny risk.

name: University of Surrey
whySelected: Frequently asked because of proximity to London with a public university profile.
visaRiskNotes: Expensive area, therefore budget constrained profiles face financial risk.

name: University of Sussex
whySelected: Often shortlisted as a credible southern option with steady international intake.
visaRiskNotes: Higher living costs in the south can stress budgets, so funding needs to be solid.

name: University of the Arts London
whySelected: Frequently asked by students targeting creative pathways, mainly because it is London based and well known.
visaRiskNotes: London costs are high and outcomes are portfolio dependent, so budget cases face risk.

name: University of Warwick
whySelected: High credibility option Indians ask about, mostly for strong profiles.
visaRiskNotes: Selective, therefore not suitable for weak academics or unclear intent.

name: University of Westminster
whySelected: Chosen mainly for London access and broad admissions pipeline.
visaRiskNotes: London cost pressure increases refusal risk for under funded students.

name: University of York
whySelected: Selective reference option with steady international intake, but not a common mass target.
visaRiskNotes: Selective and cost pressure can be material, so average profiles face risk.
